courseDetails.title: Full Stack Web App DevOps - From Idea to Cloud - All-In-One
courseDetails.shortDescription: Node.js, HTML5/CSS/JavaScript, NginX, MariaDB, VPS, DNS, HTTPS/TLS, Architecture (C4, ARC42, DaC, Requirements),  GitHub
courseDetails.longDescription:
This is Your All-in-One Full-Stack DevOps Toolkit designed to bridge the gap between coding fundamentals and professional production deployment. You will master the entire software development and deployment lifecycle—from initial planning to securing your app live in the cloud.


Your Goal: A Professional Live Full-Stack Web App

The Technology Stack: Node.js, HTML5/CSS/JavaScript, NginX/Apache, MariaDB, VPS, DNS, HTTPS/TLS, Architecture (C4, ARC42, DaC, Requirements Engineering, PlantUml),  GitHub, PAT


You will build and deploy a "Wheel of Fortune" Web App to a live Cloud VPS (DigitalOcean). Your final project will be:

  • Live on its own domain.

  • Secured with HTTPS/TLS (CertBot) and a dedicated firewall.

  • Professionally architected using the ARC42, C4 Model and DaC.


Key Course Pillars: Mastering the Professional Edge


  1. Architecture & Planning: Move beyond coding to thinking like an architect. You'll learn Requirements Engineering and use industry standards (ARC42, C4 Model, PlantUml, Drawio) to design your app structure before writing any code.

  2. Full-Stack Implementation: Build your app using a clean separation of concerns: HTML5/CSS/JavaScript for the Frontend and Node.js/Express for a REST API Backend. The data layer will be powered by MariaDB using the professional Repository Pattern (making switching the Datasource configurable).

  3. Real-World DevOps & Security: Gain crucial hands-on experience setting up a Ubuntu Cloud VPS, configuring NginX as a reverse proxy and static files server, and implementing robust security measures, including Domain/DNS setup and HTTPS/TLS encryption.


The course is built modularly, allowing you to skip sections you already master.


Stop learning in fragments. Enroll now to acquire the comprehensive skills of a highly valuable Full-Stack Software Developer and confidently deploy production-ready apps end-to-end.
targetAudiences: Junior Developers ready to transition to an Advanced of Senior role by knowing the entire Full-Stack software development lifecycle, from planning to cloud deployment.
One-Area Specialists who want to become Full-Stack Generalists and gain the comprehensive, architectural view of an entire web app.
Experienced Developers looking for a reliable, modular go-to reference to quickly refresh knowledge on specific topics like web server configuration or architecture documentation.

My digital presence extends globally, reaching enthusiasts and professionals in 152 countries. This widespread outreach has allowed me to connect with a vast audience, transcending language barriers. As an Agile Enterprise Coach, my commitment is to empower individuals worldwide with the knowledge and skills necessary for success in the dynamic field of product management. Join me on this transformative journey, and let's navigate the realm of Agile Product Management together.

Olga also shares her expertise as a lecturer at University, where she teaches presentation skills to undergraduate and graduate students. Her exceptional teaching style has earned her a spot among the top five professors at the economical faculty of the University.

With Olga as your instructor, you can expect to learn from a true expert in the field of presentation strategy. Her unique blend of hands-on experience and teaching skills will equip you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed in creating and delivering persuasive presentations.


3. Max Kalyuzhnyi, experienced entrepreneur and CFO

With over 10 years of experience in finance, investing, and entrepreneurship, I am the founder of Domicile0, a self-service platform that enables tax compliance in a borderless world. I am also an ACCA member, a CFA level III candidate, fellow of Antler entrepreneurship program and a resident of Startup Lisboa, a leading incubator for early-stage startups in Portugal.

A pitch deck is a concise and visually engaging presentation that is typically used in business settings to convey a company's or project's key information, value proposition, and investment opportunity. Pitch decks are primarily used when seeking investments, partnerships, or to secure new clients. They serve as a persuasive tool to convey the essence of your business or idea quickly and effectively. A well-crafted pitch deck can make a significant difference in the success of a business, startup, or project.

Here are the key components and the needs of usage for a pitch deck in a business context:

  1. Introduction: Start with a compelling introduction that grabs the audience's attention and provides an overview of your business or project.

  2. Problem Statement: Clearly define the problem or need that your product or service addresses. This sets the stage for why your business is relevant.

  3. Solution: Present your solution and how it addresses the identified problem. Explain how your product or service works and what makes it unique.

  4. Market Opportunity: Describe the market size and potential for your business. This includes the target audience and its demographics.

  5. Business Model: Explain how your business will generate revenue, your pricing strategy, and the sales channels you plan to use.

  6. Traction: Showcase any significant achievements, customer testimonials, or partnerships to build credibility.

  7. Competitive Analysis: Identify your competitors and explain how your business is positioned relative to them. Highlight your competitive advantages.

  8. Team: Introduce your team and their relevant experience. This builds trust and confidence in your ability to execute the business plan.

  9. Financial Projections: Present your financial forecasts, including revenue, expenses, and profitability projections. This demonstrates the potential for a return on investment.

  10. Ask: Clearly state what you are seeking from your audience, whether it's investment, partnership, or something else.


The skills related to pitching, business presenting, and business communication are important for experts and companies for several reasons:

  1. Securing Funding: Effective pitching skills are crucial when seeking investments or funding. A well-presented pitch deck can significantly increase the chances of attracting investors.

  2. Building Credibility: Strong presentation skills can help a company or individual build credibility with clients, partners, and stakeholders. A professional presentation conveys competence and confidence.

  3. Effective Communication: Business communication skills are essential for conveying ideas, plans, and strategies within a company. Clear and persuasive communication can drive team alignment and enhance productivity.

  4. Client Acquisition: In sales and client-facing roles, effective presentation and communication skills can help in acquiring new clients or customers. It can make the difference between a successful pitch and a missed opportunity.

  5. Career Advancement: For individuals, mastering these skills can lead to career advancement. Professionals who can effectively communicate their ideas and lead presentations tend to stand out and progress in their careers.

  6. Team Collaboration: Effective communication and presentation skills are essential for collaboration within teams. They help in conveying objectives, sharing updates, and ensuring everyone is on the same page.


Strong understanding of pitching, business presenting skills, and business communication skills is crucial in today's competitive business environment. These skills not only enable companies to attract investments, win clients, and build credibility but also support the career growth of individuals. A combination of these skills can lead to more successful and impactful business endeavors.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business domains or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: Modern POSH: Prevent Digital & Workplace Sexual Harassment
courseDetails.shortDescription: Complete POSH online training for office conduct, remote work safety, ICC process, and reporting harassment
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.

(Some images used in this course have been created using artificial intelligence (AI) for illustrative and educational purposes. These images are not real photographs of actual people, organisations, or events and are intended solely to support learning and understanding.)

A Deep, Practical Workplace Course | Includes Video Lectures, Quizzes & Role-Play Scenarios

Disclaimer: This is not a 30-minute, checkbox-style training designed to be completed and forgotten. This course is intentionally designed to explore digital & workplace harassment in depth, with care, context, and practical application.

Sexual harassment and digital misconduct are sensitive, deeply human issues that affect dignity, safety, careers, and workplace trust. They deserve time, context, and thoughtful discussion — not rushed definitions or fear-driven compliance slides.

This course is intentionally designed to explore POSH and modern digital harassment in depth and with care. It goes beyond legal definitions to help you recognise real situations, reflect on lived experiences, and respond with confidence in today’s evolving workplaces — including remote, hybrid, and AI-enabled environments.

If you are an employee, manager, HR professional, or people leader who wants to contribute to a workplace that is safe, respectful, and accountable, this course is for you. Have you ever wondered whether a comment, message, joke, or online interaction crossed the line? Do you worry about reporting the wrong way, staying silent, or responding incorrectly when something feels uncomfortable? In modern workplaces, boundaries are not always obvious — and the consequences of misunderstanding them can be serious.

A key strength of this course is that it approaches POSH and digital harassment from multiple, real-world perspectives. You will explore situations through the lens of the person experiencing harm, the bystander who witnesses it, the supervisor or manager expected to respond, and the leadership or HR professional responsible for investigation, compliance, and culture. This multi-perspective approach helps you see the full picture — not just what happens, but how decisions, silence, or action impact everyone involved.

In this course, you will:

  • Develop the ability to identify sexual harassment across physical, digital, remote, and AI-enabled work environments.

  • Distinguish between intent and impact, and recognise why “unwelcome” conduct matters more than intention.

  • Detect subtle, identity-based harassment, microaggressions, and power-driven behaviours before they escalate.

  • Apply appropriate responses from different roles — whether you are the person affected, a bystander, a manager, or part of HR or leadership.

  • Navigate reporting and investigation processes with clarity, including roles, responsibilities, and compliance risks.

  • Strengthen bystander intervention and shared accountability across teams.

  • Build a prevention-first mindset that supports healing, trust, and long-term cultural change.

Why does this topic matter so much? Because harassment — especially when ignored, minimised, or mishandled — erodes trust, harms mental well-being, and exposes organisations to serious legal and reputational risk. As work increasingly happens through messages, video calls, collaboration tools, and AI systems, the nature of harassment is changing. Understanding modern POSH is no longer optional; it is a shared workplace responsibility.

Throughout the course, you will engage with reflective exercises, real-world case scenarios, scenario-based quizzes, and guided role-play simulations that mirror what employees, managers, and HR teams actually face. These activities help you move from awareness to action — so you are prepared not just to recognise issues, but to respond thoughtfully and responsibly from your role.

What makes this course different is its balanced and respectful approach. It does not rely on fear, blame, or legal overload. Instead, it combines compliance awareness with empathy, clarity, and practical decision-making — making it suitable for global workplaces while remaining deeply relatable and human.

By the end of this course, you won’t just know the policy — you’ll understand your role, your responsibility, and your power to make workplaces safer.

Enroll now and take an active step toward seeing it, speaking up, preventing it, and understanding why it matters.
targetAudiences: Employees who want to recognise, respond to, and report harassment safely in modern, digital, and remote workplaces.
People managers and supervisors who want to handle complaints responsibly, confidently, and in line with legal and organisational expectations.
HR professionals who want to strengthen investigation practices, documentation, and compliance while building trust with employees.
Organisational leaders who want to move beyond checkbox compliance and create genuinely respectful, safe workplace cultures.
Bystanders and team members who want to intervene appropriately and support colleagues without escalating risk.
Professionals working in hybrid or remote roles who want clarity on digital, online, and AI-related harassment boundaries.

courseDetails.title: Advanced Power BI: Expert Data Analysis and Visualization
courseDetails.shortDescription: From Data to Decisions with Advanced Modeling Techniques
courseDetails.longDescription:
This Advanced Power BI course is meticulously designed to equip professionals with the expertise needed to master data analytics and visualization at an advanced level. By delving into critical aspects such as data transformation, modeling, and visualization, this course ensures you gain comprehensive skills to handle complex data scenarios effectively. Participants will learn to connect and consolidate data from diverse sources, automate data processes, and build robust data models. The course also covers advanced topics like role-level security, fuzzy matching, and the creation of transformation tables, enabling you to manage and protect data with confidence.

Taking this course will provide you with practical, hands-on experience through real-world applications and case studies. You will learn to create insightful reports and compelling visualizations that drive informed decision-making. By the end of the course, you will be equipped not only with advanced technical skills but also with the ability to apply these techniques to solve business problems and optimize data-driven strategies. This course is ideal for professionals looking to elevate their Power BI capabilities and leverage data analytics to achieve business success.

  1. Introduction to Advanced Power BI Course

    • Introduction to the trainer

    • Overview of the course

    • Common challenges in mastering Power BI

    • Importance of core concepts

  2. Data Cycle: Getting Data

    • Handling data quality issues

    • Using transformation tables with fuzzy matching

    • Hands-on practice with transformation tables

    • Troubleshooting common problems

    • Performing sense checks

    • Case study: transforming city data

    • Applying learned techniques

    • Reinforcing key concepts through practical application

    • Cleaning and transforming sales data

    • Handling errors and missing values

    • Importing and cleaning product data

    • Standardizing product information

    • Understanding cardinality in relationships

    • Introduction to normalizing flat files

courseDetails.title: The Psychology of Stress and Mental Disorders
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master the psychology behind stress, coping, and happiness using evidence-based mental health strategies.
courseDetails.longDescription:
“This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.”

A complete guide to the psychological foundations of well-being, resilience, and emotional balance.

Do you ever feel overwhelmed, mentally exhausted, or stuck in emotional patterns you can’t escape? Have you wondered why stress affects some people more than others, or why certain individuals thrive under pressure while others break down?

The answer lies in psychology—and in this course, you’ll finally understand it in a clear, practical, life-changing way.

This course is a deep exploration into the psychology of stress, well-being, and mental health, based on decades of scientific research and real-world application. You’ll learn the major theories behind human motivation, happiness, coping, emotional resilience, and mental disorders—and most importantly, how to use that knowledge to improve your life.

You’ll discover how the mind evaluates threats, how emotions influence decisions, how stress becomes chronic, and how certain thinking patterns silently shape your mental health. We’ll break down everything from hedonic adaptation to defense mechanisms, from self-determination theory to cognitive appraisal—and turn it into tools you can use immediately.

If you want to understand why the mind works the way it does, and how to manage stress, relationships, habits, and emotions with confidence, clarity, and scientific insight—this course is for you.

What Makes This Course Powerful?

Unlike motivational courses that tell you to “just think positive,” this course gives you real psychology, including:

  • Why stress exists and how it affects the brain

  • How happiness is influenced by genetics, habits, and life events

  • Why some people cope better than others

  • How irrational thinking and defense mechanisms distort reality

  • The psychological roots of anxiety and depression

  • What resilience and psychological hardiness really look like

  • How to change your emotional responses and thinking patterns

And it’s all explained in everyday language—with examples, stories, case studies, and practical tips for real life.

This Course Is Designed to Transform You

By the end of this program, you will:

  • Understand the true nature of stress and how to control it

  • Break free from negative thoughts, overthinking, and emotional traps

  • Strengthen your psychological immune system

  • Build resilience, confidence, and emotional stability

  • Improve your relationships and mental health

  • Make science-based changes that actually stick

  • Create a personalized plan to support your well-being

This isn’t just about feeling better—it’s about building mental strength and long-term psychological health.

Learn the Science Behind:

  • The psychology of happiness and motivation

  • Stress and coping mechanisms

  • Emotions and mental resilience

  • Mental disorders and breakdowns

  • Positive psychology and self-growth

  • Why the brain resists change—and how to overcome it

    You don’t need any background in psychology. We start from the basics and climb step by step into deeper understanding.

What You’ll Get

  • Step-by-step lessons and clear explanations

  • Practical tools you can apply instantly

  • Downloadable worksheets and exercises

  • Scientific principles presented in simple language

  • Real examples and guided strategies

By the end of this course, you won’t just understand psychology—you’ll be able to use it to change your life.

Final Promise

This course is designed to open your eyes, challenge your thinking, improve your mental strength, and make well-being achievable. Whether you want to grow personally, professionally, or emotionally, these lessons will stay with you for life.

Enroll now, and take the first step toward a stronger, calmer, and healthier mind.

courseDetails.title: Power BI DAX Mastery: Advanced Formulas and Data Analysis
courseDetails.shortDescription: Mastering Complex Calculations and Dynamic Reporting in Power BI
courseDetails.longDescription:
"Power BI DAX Mastery" is an intensive training course designed to equip data analysts and business intelligence professionals with advanced skills in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX). This course provides a comprehensive understanding of DAX, enabling participants to build sophisticated data models, create complex calculations, and develop insightful Power BI reports.

Led by expert trainer Ali Noorani, this course focuses on practical applications, best practices, and hands-on problem-solving techniques. Participants will gain valuable insights into DAX's role in data modeling, visualization, and analytics, empowering them to drive data-driven decision-making within their organizations.

By the end of this course, attendees will have mastered advanced DAX functionalities, allowing them to perform in-depth data analysis and create dynamic, interactive reports that provide valuable business insights.

Course Outline:

  1. Introduction to Advanced DAX Concepts

    • Overview of DAX and its importance in Power BI.

    • Key differences between Calculated Columns and Measures.

    • Understanding the foundational principles of DAX.

  2. Building and Optimizing Data Models

    • Introduction to data modeling in Power BI.

    • Best practices for creating and managing data models.

    • Techniques for visualizing data effectively.

  3. Understanding and Applying Filter Context

    • Deep dive into filter context and its impact on DAX calculations.

    • How to use filter context to control data visibility and calculation results.

    • Practical examples of using filter context in real-world scenarios.

  4. Creating and Using Measures

    • Step-by-step guide to creating basic and advanced measures.

    • Techniques for using measures to perform dynamic calculations.

    • Examples of measures for common business scenarios (e.g., total sales, profit margin).

  5. Advanced Problem-Solving with DAX

    • Strategies for solving complex analytical problems using DAX.

    • How to use DAX functions such as CALCULATE, FILTER, and SUMX to solve business problems.

    • Case studies demonstrating the application of DAX for business insights.

  6. Implementing Time Intelligence Functions

    • Overview of time intelligence functions in DAX.

    • Techniques for calculating year-over-year growth, month-over-month trends, and moving averages.

    • Practical exercises to understand time-based calculations and forecasts.

  7. Dynamic Filtering and Interactive Reporting

    • How to implement dynamic filtering using slicers and DAX.

    • Creating interactive reports that respond to user selections.

    • Examples of dynamic reporting for different business dimensions (e.g., by region, by product category).

  8. Creating and Using Calendar Tables

    • Importance of calendar tables in time-based analysis.

    • How to create a calendar table using DAX.

    • Best practices for managing date-related data in Power BI.

  9. Practical Applications of DAX in Business Scenarios

    • Real-world examples of using DAX to address business needs.

    • How to create dashboards that provide actionable insights.

    • Techniques for using DAX to optimize business operations and strategy.
targetAudiences: Business Analysts looking to enhance their data modeling and reporting skills using advanced DAX formulas in Power BI.
Data Professionals who want to deepen their understanding of DAX for complex data calculations and insights.
Excel Power Users transitioning to Power BI and aiming to leverage their existing formula knowledge in a more powerful business intelligence tool.
Power BI Enthusiasts at an intermediate level who are ready to dive into more advanced DAX topics to unlock dynamic and insightful reporting capabilities.

Hello, and welcome to our course on Employee Engagement and Employee Relations. I’m excited to have you with us as we dive into two of the most essential aspects of modern workplace dynamics.

In this course, we’ll explore the Importance of Employee Relations in the Workplace—a crucial element for fostering a cohesive and productive work environment. Strong employee relations not only promote trust and communication but also serve as the foundation for long-term organizational success.

We’ll also discuss the Role of HR in Managing Employee Relations. Human Resources plays a pivotal role in maintaining positive relationships between employees and management. We'll examine best practices, policies, and frameworks that HR professionals use to create a healthy, collaborative workplace.

Next, we’ll cover Employee Engagement—a key factor that directly influences organizational performance. We’ll explore how increased engagement leads to better productivity, innovation, and overall business outcomes.

To further support your understanding, we’ll look at Tools and Techniques for Measuring Employee Engagement. Knowing how to assess engagement levels is essential for identifying both strengths and areas for improvement. Moreover, we’ll examine Strategies for Enhancing Employee Engagement, offering practical insights and approaches to inspire commitment, enthusiasm, and motivation within your workforce.

Finally, we’ll focus on Building a Positive Work Environment, which is vital for nurturing employee satisfaction, reducing turnover, and fostering long-term loyalty.

By the end of this course, you’ll be equipped with the knowledge and tools to strengthen employee relations, boost engagement, and drive your organization’s success. Let’s begin and transform the way you approach employee engagement and relations!


Discussing employee relations and employee engagement together in one online course makes sense because both concepts are deeply interconnected and play a crucial role in creating a positive work environment and driving organizational success. Here's why it’s beneficial to cover both topics in a single course:


1. Interconnectedness of Concepts:

Employee Relations focuses on the relationship between employers and employees, encompassing everything from conflict resolution and communication to fair treatment and legal compliance. Strong employee relations are the foundation for a positive work environment where employees feel respected and valued.

Employee Engagement is about how emotionally invested and motivated employees are in their work and the organization. High levels of engagement are often the result of effective employee relations. When employees feel that their concerns are addressed, their contributions are recognized, and they are treated fairly, they are more likely to be engaged.


2. Holistic Approach to HR Management:

Combining employee relations and engagement in one course allows for a more comprehensive understanding of how to manage and motivate employees. It enables HR professionals to see the bigger picture of how managing relationships directly impacts engagement levels, and how engaged employees contribute to better employee relations.


3. Strategies for Improvement:

Discussing both topics together allows for the exploration of strategies that improve both employee relations and engagement simultaneously. For example, open communication channels and conflict resolution mechanisms can enhance both relations and engagement. Recognizing and rewarding employees also strengthens both areas.


4. Efficiency in Learning:

Since both employee relations and engagement involve overlapping areas of HR practice, addressing them in a single course makes learning more efficient. HR professionals can gain insights into how improving one area can positively impact the other, leading to a more integrated approach to workforce management.


5. Practical Application:

A combined course can provide practical tools and frameworks that address both employee relations and engagement. For example, a module on conflict resolution might not only teach how to resolve disputes but also how to turn those resolutions into opportunities for increasing employee engagement.


6. Organizational Culture and Performance:

The course can help participants understand how both employee relations and engagement contribute to building a positive organizational culture. A strong culture, in turn, enhances performance, reduces turnover, and makes the organization a more attractive place to work.


In summary, discussing employee relations and employee engagement together in one online course provides a more complete understanding of how to create a positive, productive, and motivated workforce. By learning about both areas in tandem, HR professionals can develop strategies that support a healthy work environment and drive organizational success.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at Human Resources or improve their knowledge.

Starting in an academic environment, where he obtained his PhD in Engineering and an MBA at Universidade Nova de Lisboa, quickly evolved to C-suite positions in the corporate environment, both in large corporations and in start-ups.

He is currently a director and start-up shareholder in an IT integrator in Lisbon, focused on cybersecurity. With a passion for education, he also an invited Professor at Nova Information Management School, teaching Knowledge Management and Financial Analysis to graduate and undergraduate students.


Business leadership is the art of guiding an organization towards success. It involves setting a clear vision, inspiring employees, and making strategic decisions that propel the company forward. Effective leaders create a positive work environment where people feel motivated and empowered to contribute their best.


Core Functions of a Business Leader:

  • Visionary: Business leaders paint a picture of the future – the company's goals and aspirations. They articulate a compelling vision that excites and unites the team.

  • Strategic Decision-Making: Leaders make tough calls, weighing risks and opportunities to navigate the business towards its goals.

  • Motivator and Coach: They inspire and empower employees, helping them grow and develop their skills.

  • Effective Communicator: Leaders clearly communicate the vision, plans, and expectations to everyone in the organization.

  • Team Builder: They foster collaboration and build strong, cohesive teams that work effectively together.


Why Leadership Skills Matter for Your Career:

Developing leadership skills is crucial for career advancement. Here's why:

  • Increased Visibility: Leaders stand out. They take initiative, solve problems, and get things done, which grabs the attention of superiors.

  • Promotion Potential: Companies are always looking for strong leaders to fill management positions.

  • Stronger Teams: If you can lead and motivate others, you'll be a valuable asset on any team, making you a desirable candidate for projects and assignments.

  • Adaptability and Change: The business world is constantly evolving. Strong leadership skills equip you to adapt to change and navigate challenges.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: Practical OSINT: The Complete Course for Beginners
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn Google Dorking, Social Media OSINT, Leaked Databases, Anonymity, Website Recon, Image OSINT & More!
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.

Ever wondered how investigators find information that seems impossible to locate? How do they track digital footprints, uncover hidden connections, and piece together a complete puzzle from scattered clues online? Welcome to Practical OSINT.

This is not just a theoretical course; it is your hands-on guide to mastering the art and science of Open Source Intelligence. In over 9 hours of content, you will move from a complete beginner to a skilled investigator. We start from the very beginning by helping you build a secure, professional investigation lab from scratch using tools like VMWare and Kali Linux.

From there, we dive into the most critical OSINT techniques used by cybersecurity professionals and ethical hackers today. You will learn to think like an investigator, mastering everything from advanced Google Dorking and social media analysis to exploring massive leaked databases and tracking phone numbers. You will not only learn how to find information but also how to protect your own identity using sock puppets , private VPNs , and advanced data hiding techniques like steganography.

If you are ready to stop just using the internet and start understanding it, this course is your first step. Enrol today and start your journey into the fascinating world of Open Source Intelligence.

A Look Inside The Course Curriculum

Here is a breakdown of the exciting skills you will master in each section:

Section 1: Introduction

  • Get a complete overview of the course structure and meet your instructor, WHO AM I.

Section 2: Lab Setup

  • Build your digital detective's toolkit from the ground up. We'll guide you through installing VMWare , setting up Kali Linux , and even show you how to build an ultimate OSINT lab in the cloud.

Section 3: Search Engines

  • Go beyond basic searching and master Google Dorking. You'll learn basic people searching techniques , how to discover hidden files and metadata , and even use AI for advanced dorking.

Section 4: Emails, Usernames, Passwords

  • Dive into the world of digital identity. Learn to find emails , trace usernames , and understand the impact of breached credentials and password leaks.

Section 5: Finding and Downloading Leaked Databases

  • Gain elite skills by learning how to find and download leaked databases. We'll set up a Windows VM and use special tools to explore real-world data breaches from Facebook , Twitter , and LinkedIn.

Section 6: Phone Numbers OSINT

  • Turn a single phone number into a trove of information. You'll learn to hunt for numbers , validate them , find the owner's identity , and link them to social media accounts.

Section 7: People OSINT

  • Become an expert in finding information about people. We'll cover people search engines , tracing name origins , finding linked social media accounts , political affiliations , and even searching CVs.

Section 8: Social Media OSINT

  • Learn specific techniques for investigating popular platforms, including Instagram , Facebook , TikTok , Twitter , and LinkedIn. You'll even learn a method to find the IP address of a WhatsApp number.

Section 9: Image OSINT

  • Unlock the secrets hidden in images. You'll master metadata analysis, reverse image searching , face searching , and using AI for image geolocation.

Section 10: Email Forensics

  • Learn to analyze emails like a forensic investigator by tracking them and analyzing phishing attempts in a hands-on challenge.

Section 11: Files OSINT

  • Discover how to use file diggers to find documents and other files that aren't easily accessible.

Section 12: IoT OSINT

  • Explore the Internet of Things. You'll learn to use Shodan and Censys to find exposed devices, including vulnerable cameras.

Section 13: Website OSINT

  • Conduct a complete reconnaissance on any website. You'll learn everything from finding the technology stack and subdomains to analyzing security headers , DNS records , and finding historical data.

Section 14: Staying Anonymous

  • Take your privacy to the next level. Learn to use disposable browsers and set up your own free, private, and even unblockable VPN server in the cloud.

Section 15: Hiding Activities, Data & Files

  • Learn the art of digital concealment. You will master steganography to hide data in images and text , use covert communication techniques , and encrypt your files and disks using professional tools like Veracrypt
targetAudiences: Aspiring Ethical Hackers and Penetration Testers who want to master the reconnaissance phase with practical OSINT skills
Cybersecurity students and professionals looking to add hands-on Open Source Intelligence techniques to their toolkit
Journalists, researchers, and private investigators who need to find and verify information on people, companies, and events online
Absolute beginners with no prior experience in cybersecurity or OSINT who are looking for a comprehensive A-Z guide
Anyone interested in learning how digital footprints are created online and how to protect their own privacy and anonymity

Course Author:

Dr. Joao Martins is seasoned manager and entrepreneur, with over 30 years’ experience in top management positions in the telecommunications and IT sectors. Starting in an academic environment, where he obtained his PhD in Engineering and an MBA at Universidade Nova de Lisboa, quickly evolved to C-suite positions in the corporate environment, both in large corporations and in start-ups.

He is currently a director and start-up shareholder in an IT integrator in Lisbon, focused on cybersecurity. With a passion for education, he also an invited Professor at Nova Information Management School, teaching Knowledge Management and Financial Analysis to graduate and undergraduate students.


Entrepreneurship is the process of identifying opportunities, innovating, and taking risks to create and manage a business venture. It involves the willingness to bear uncertainty and the capacity to adapt to changing circumstances in order to achieve success. Entrepreneurs are individuals who embark on this journey, utilizing their creativity, vision, and determination to bring their ideas to life.

There are several main reasons why individuals choose to become entrepreneurs and build their own businesses:

  1. Pursuit of Passion: Many entrepreneurs are driven by a passion for a particular idea, product, or service. They want to bring their vision to fruition and make a meaningful impact in their chosen field.

  2. Financial Independence: Building a successful business can provide financial freedom and independence. Entrepreneurs have the opportunity to create wealth for themselves and their families by capitalizing on their own ideas and hard work.

  3. Flexibility and Autonomy: Entrepreneurship offers the flexibility to set one's own schedule and work on projects that align with personal values and goals. Entrepreneurs have the autonomy to make decisions and shape the direction of their businesses as they see fit.

  4. Desire for Innovation: Entrepreneurship is often driven by a desire to innovate and create something new. Entrepreneurs seek to solve problems, disrupt industries, and introduce novel solutions that improve people's lives.

  5. Personal Growth and Fulfillment: Building a business can be a deeply rewarding experience that fosters personal growth and fulfillment. Entrepreneurs face challenges, overcome obstacles, and learn valuable lessons along the way, which can lead to a sense of accomplishment and fulfillment.


Learning about business can provide essential knowledge and skills that support the process of building a career and launching a startup. Some ways in which learning about business can be beneficial include:

  1. Understanding Market Dynamics: A solid understanding of business principles can help entrepreneurs identify market opportunities, assess demand for their products or services, and develop effective strategies for reaching their target audience.

  2. Financial Management: Learning about finance and accounting is crucial for managing the financial aspects of a business, including budgeting, forecasting, and managing cash flow. This knowledge is essential for making informed decisions and ensuring the financial health of a startup.

  3. Marketing and Sales: Effective marketing and sales strategies are essential for attracting customers and growing a business. Learning about marketing principles, branding, and customer acquisition can help entrepreneurs develop strategies to effectively promote their products or services and drive sales.

  4. Leadership and Management: Learning about leadership and management principles can help entrepreneurs build and lead high-performing teams, delegate tasks effectively, and create a positive work culture within their organizations.

Overall, learning about business can provide entrepreneurs with the knowledge, skills, and confidence they need to navigate the challenges of entrepreneurship, build successful businesses, and achieve their goals.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business or improve their knowledge.

Instead of learning Spark through boring theory, you’ll build a complete analytics project step by step, uncovering insights like:

  • Which countries dominate Olympic Gold medals?

  • How have athlete ages and physiques evolved over time?

  • Are female athletes growing faster in participation than males?

  • Which sports produce the most champions?

  • Do athletes over 50 still win medals?

By the end of this course, you’ll confidently be able to:

  • Load real datasets using Apache Zeppelin Notebooks

  • Write advanced SQL queries for aggregation, filtering, and joins

  • Analyze Age, Height, Weight, Gender & Medal trends across decades

  • Build a portfolio-ready Olympic Analytics Dashboard

Tools                                             Purpose

courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Business & Science Method, Analysis & Research Methodologies by MTF Institute


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 210 countries and has been chosen by more than 520 000 students.


Course Author:

Cristiana Silva is a senior education technician with 4 years' experience in coordinating pedagogical and social projects in Higher Education Institutions and Private Social Solidarity Institutions. She began her work in an academic environment, where she obtained her Master's Degree in Education, in the specialization area of Adult Education and Community Intervention at the University of Minho and worked as an educational researcher, responsible for designing course curricula and managing course quality assessment processes. She is currently a learning designer at the Polytechnic of Cávado and Ave in Barcelos. With a passion for adult education, she has also been president of the C.R.I.A. Dialogues Association since 2021.


The short course "Research Methodologies" aims to provide an introductory understanding of scientific research in Administration. This course equips students with the necessary skills to design, develop, and evaluate research plans. As future business managers, students should be able to use data collection techniques and instruments to develop or improve business strategies, such as questionnaires, interviews, and document analysis.

At the end of the course, students should be able to:

  • Understand the characteristics of management research.

  • Explain techniques and instruments for collecting and analyzing data.

  • Write, present, and disseminate scientific work.

  • Understand ethical principles in research.

  • Prepare bibliographical references.


The structure of the search methodologies course:

  • Characteristics and paradigms of management research

  • Techniques and instruments for collecting and analyzing data

  • Research methodologies

  • Writing, presenting, and disseminating scientific work

  • Ethics in research

  • Bibliographical references


This course lays the foundation for both academic success and effective business management by equipping students with the essential skills to conduct rigorous research and analyze complex information.


1. Scientific Activity and Capstone Project Preparation

  • Research Design: The course empowers students to design robust research studies. This includes formulating clear research questions, selecting appropriate methodologies, and collecting and analyzing data systematically. These skills are crucial for scientific investigations and directly applicable to the Capstone Project, where students are expected to conduct independent research.

  • Critical Thinking and Data Analysis: Students learn to approach information critically, evaluate evidence, and draw sound conclusions. This analytical mindset is essential in science and in crafting a compelling Capstone Project that demonstrates a deep understanding of a chosen topic.

  • Scientific Communication: The course helps students develop effective communication skills, enabling them to present their findings clearly and persuasively, both in written and oral formats. This skill is vital for sharing research results within the scientific community and defending the Capstone Project before a panel.


2. Application in Real Business and Management

  • Informed Decision-Making: In the business world, decisions must be based on solid evidence. The course equips students with the tools to conduct market research, analyze competitor strategies, and evaluate the effectiveness of various business initiatives. This data-driven approach minimizes risks and maximizes opportunities.

  • Problem-Solving: Businesses constantly face challenges. The course teaches students to identify problems, gather relevant data, analyze the root causes, and develop effective solutions. This structured problem-solving approach is invaluable for managers at all levels.

  • Performance Evaluation: The ability to measure and compare results is essential for continuous improvement. The course enables students to track key performance indicators, identify trends, and make data-driven adjustments to optimize business outcomes.

  • Innovation and Adaptation: The business landscape is constantly evolving. The course fosters a mindset of curiosity and inquiry, encouraging students to stay abreast of new developments, conduct research, and adapt their strategies to remain competitive.


"Business & Science Method, Analysis & Research Methodologies" provides students with a versatile skillset that is crucial for both academic and professional success. By emphasizing rigorous research, critical thinking, and effective communication, the course empowers students to make informed decisions, solve complex problems, and drive innovation in the dynamic world of business.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in Business or Science

courseDetails.title: Certificado Profissional em Gestão de Projetos
courseDetails.shortDescription: Compreender a Gestão de Projetos, Funções Principais, Papel de um Gestor de Projeto, Project Lifecycle, Metodologia
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao Curso: Certificado Profissional em Liderança e Gestão


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance.  

O MTF é um instituto global de educação e investigação, com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado na formação empresarial e profissional híbrida (presencial e online) nas áreas de: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de I&D do MTF foca-se em atividades de investigação nas áreas de: Inteligência Artificial, Aprendizagem Automática (Machine Learning), Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico e Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da IBM, Intel e Microsoft, e membro da Câmara de Comércio e Indústria Portuguesa.

O MTF está presente em 213 países e foi escolhido por mais de 560 000 alunos.


Autor do curso:

Ana Cristina M. B. Saraiva é uma profissional distinta com uma sólida combinação de experiência académica e empresarial, especializada em gestão, ética, desenvolvimento estratégico e liderança. Obteve o Doutoramento em Gestão pela Universidade Lusíada de Lisboa, onde se destacou nas áreas de gestão empresarial, e-commerce, análise crítica de modelos de gestão e metodologias de investigação avançadas, recebendo grande reconhecimento pelas suas contribuições na área.

Atualmente, exerce funções como Gestora de Projetos na Associação Portuguesa de Ética Empresarial (APEE). Este papel sublinha o seu compromisso com a promoção da inovação ética e da sustentabilidade nas organizações e nos setores público e privado.

Relativamente à sua área académica, Ana Saraiva fez contribuições significativas como consultora e investigadora no centro de investigação COMEGI da Universidade Lusíada. Colaborou com prestigiadas instituições nacionais e internacionais, incluindo o IST (Universidade de Lisboa) e várias universidades europeias, avançando na investigação e implementando soluções inovadoras nas práticas de gestão organizacionais. A sua experiência editorial inclui a gestão e indexação de revistas científicas em plataformas como Scopus, DOAJ e outras de prestígio, refletindo a sua dedicação nos elevados padrões académicos.

Com uma experiência empresarial de mais de uma década, Ana trabalhou na hotelaria de luxo, onde liderou esforços na coordenação de eventos, na garantia de qualidade e na satisfação dos hóspedes. Possui um histórico comprovado de melhoria da excelência operacional e gestão estratégica, sendo uma líder versátil e capaz de impulsionar resultados nos mais diversificados contextos.

A produção académica de Ana Saraiva é vasta, incluindo numerosos artigos revistos por pares e apresentações em conferências que abordam questões críticas em gestão, ética e transformação digital. É proficiente numa ampla gama de ferramentas e plataformas digitais, como SPSS, SAS e NVivo, utilizadas para otimizar os resultados de investigação e de negócios.

Com uma paixão pela colaboração interdisciplinar e um compromisso com práticas éticas e sustentáveis, Ana Cristina M. B. Saraiva dedica-se a capacitar organizações e indivíduos para alcançar a excelência através de soluções inovadoras e liderança responsável no panorama global dos negócios.


O que é Gestão de Projetos?

Gestão de projetos é a aplicação organizada de conhecimentos, processos, habilidades e ferramentas para guiar um projeto desde o seu início até a sua conclusão bem-sucedida. Envolve:

  • Definir metas: Decidir o que o projeto deve alcançar.

  • Planejamento: Mapear as etapas e os recursos necessários.

  • Execução: Colocar o plano em ação, direcionar a equipe e gerenciar os recursos.

  • Monitoramento e controle: Acompanhar o progresso, gerenciar mudanças e resolver problemas.

  • Encerramento: Revisar o projeto, documentar os resultados e aprender com a experiência.


O que é Gestão de Projetos de Negócios?

A gestão de projetos de negócios refere-se à aplicação de princípios de gestão de projetos em um ambiente de negócios. Esses projetos se concentram em alcançar objetivos de negócios, como:

  • Lançamento de novos produtos ou serviços

  • Melhorar ou automatizar processos de negócios

  • Reestruturar departamentos

  • Implementar novos sistemas de software


O Papel da Gestão de Projetos

A gestão de projetos desempenha um papel fundamental nas empresas porque:

  • Aumenta a Eficiência: Um plano de projeto bem definido ajuda a otimizar o trabalho e evitar o desperdício de esforço.

  • Garante Resultados: A gestão de projetos mantém o foco em cumprir as metas definidas dentro das restrições de tempo e orçamento.

  • Gerencia Riscos: Problemas potenciais são antecipados e mitigados por meio de planejamento e monitoramento cuidadosos.

  • Melhora a Comunicação: Canais de comunicação claros entre membros da equipe, stakeholders e clientes ajudam a evitar mal-entendidos.

  • Melhora a Satisfação do Cliente: A conclusão bem-sucedida do projeto dentro dos parâmetros acordados gera confiança com os clientes.


Por que aprender gestão de projetos é importante para as empresas?

As empresas investem no treinamento de gestão de projetos de seus funcionários porque:

  • Vantagem Competitiva: Empresas com fortes capacidades de gestão de projetos entregam projetos com mais sucesso, ganham reputação de confiabilidade e superam os concorrentes.

  • Reduz Custos: Projetos ineficientes custam mais devido a atrasos e desperdício de recursos. A gestão de projetos ajuda a otimizar os recursos.

  • Melhora o Moral dos Funcionários: Projetos bem administrados minimizam o estresse, melhoram a colaboração da equipe e criam um senso de realização.

  • Melhora a Inovação: A gestão de projetos estruturada permite gerenciar projetos de inovação, levando a uma cultura de inovação dentro da empresa.


Como as habilidades de gerenciamento de projetos impulsionam sua carreira

Desenvolver suas habilidades de gerenciamento de projetos pode melhorar significativamente suas perspectivas de carreira:

  • Alta Demanda: Gerentes de projeto são procurados em todos os setores, como TI, construção, saúde, etc.

  • Melhor Salário: Gerentes de projeto qualificados geralmente ganham salários mais altos devido à sua experiência.

  • Potencial de Liderança: A gestão de projetos fornece uma base sólida para assumir funções de liderança dentro das organizações.

  • Versatilidade: As habilidades de gerenciamento de projetos se aplicam a uma ampla gama de empregos e funções, não apenas a cargos de gerenciamento de projetos.

  • Crescimento Pessoal: Você desenvolverá habilidades organizacionais, de resolução de problemas e de comunicação, tornando-se um trunfo para qualquer equipe.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Gestão

courseDetails.title: Strategic Workplace Communication: Intent and Method
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master essential communication skills to inform, influence, and inspire—using the right tools, tone, and strategy
courseDetails.longDescription:
“This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.”

Clear, confident, and strategic communication is the foundation of every successful career. Whether you're writing emails, giving feedback, presenting ideas, or navigating challenging conversations, what you say—and how you say it—shapes your impact at work.

This beginner-friendly course teaches you to communicate like a leader, even if you're just starting your career. You’ll learn how to match your message to the right channel, write emails that get results, give supportive feedback, manage emotions during conversations, protect privacy, and communicate ethically.

By the end, you’ll be able to turn everyday messages into opportunities to build trust, strengthen relationships, and inspire positive action.

Stop hoping your message lands—start ensuring it delivers results.

Communication is more than just speaking or writing—it’s the skill that shapes your professional identity. Every email you send, every meeting you attend, every idea you present, and every feedback conversation you navigate contributes to how others perceive your competence, confidence, and leadership potential.

Welcome to Strategic Workplace Communication: Intent and Method—a practical, beginner-friendly course designed to transform the way you communicate at work. Whether you're starting your career, preparing for your first job, or simply wanting to feel more confident and effective in professional conversations, this course gives you the tools to communicate with clarity, purpose, and impact.

In today’s fast-paced workplace, miscommunication is one of the biggest sources of conflict, stress, and lost productivity. Maybe your emails often get misunderstood. Maybe giving feedback feels awkward. Maybe speaking up in meetings is intimidating. Or maybe you simply want to sound more professional, organized, and persuasive.

This course breaks down communication into simple, actionable steps—helping you choose the right method for the right message, build strong face-to-face presence, write better emails, handle emotions intelligently, and communicate with honesty and empathy. You’ll learn how to deliver feedback without hurting relationships, how to protect privacy in sensitive situations, and how to organize your thoughts using a “Leader’s Script” so your ideas inspire action instead of confusion.

Each module includes real-world examples, simple frameworks, and practical exercises that you can apply immediately in the workplace. You’ll walk away with the confidence to express yourself clearly, the skills to manage tough conversations, and a strong communication foundation that accelerates your career growth.

If you’re ready to stop guessing and start communicating with intention—this course is for you.

Enroll now and unlock the communication skills you need to succeed, stand out, and lead with confidence.
targetAudiences: Students and fresh graduates
Entry-level professionals in any field
Team members who want clearer communication at work
Job seekers preparing for professional environments
Anyone who wants to speak and write with confidence
